intro: Elatostema binatum, commonly known as the small-leaf elatostema, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its rosette-like arrangement of narrow, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in a spike, often emerging from the center of the rosette. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. Elatostema binatum is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
